action_title: Wear face-masks to avoid transmission of viral and bacterial diseases to primates
key_messages:
Key Messages:

One study in Uganda found that a confiscated young chimpanzee was reunited with its mother after being handled by caretakers wearing face-masks, alongside other interventions.
One before-and-after study in Rwanda, Uganda and the Democratic Republic of CongoÂ found that numbers of mountain gorillas increased by 168% over 41 years while being visited by researchers and visitors wearing face-masks, alongside other interventions.
